issue.title: Type traits must not be final

discussion.p:
We should make it clear that all standard UnaryTypeTraits, BinaryTypeTraits and TransformationTraits are not final.
Otherwise it is not safe to use them as arguments to a template like this:

blockquote.pre: template<typename C1, typename C2> struct conjunction : conditional_t<C1::value, C2, C1> { };

discussion.p: Walter, Nevin, and Jason provide initial Proposed Resolution.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4606.

-1- A UnaryTypeTrait describes a property of a type. It shall be a non-final class template […]
-2- A BinaryTypeTrait describes a relationship between two types. It shall be a non-final class template […]
-3- A TransformationTrait modifies a property of a type. It shall be a non-final class template […]

discussion.p: LWG discusses and expresses preference for a more general, Library-wide, resolution. Walter and Nevin provide a new Proposed Resolution consistent with such guidance.
Thurs PM: Moved to Tentatively Ready

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4606.

li.p: Add a new paragraph add the end of as indicated:

p.ins: -?- All types specified in the C++ standard library shall be non-final types unless otherwise specified.
